The correct answer is:

C. User is taken to developer.force.com page

Explanation:

When a user clicks on the “Create New Apps” option in the List of Apps section, they are redirected to the developer.force.com page. This page provides resources and tools for developers to create new applications on the Salesforce platform, such as custom apps, integrations, and more.

Incorrect Options:
 • A. User is taken to a Create new App Page in salesforce.com: There is no direct “Create new App” page within Salesforce itself; app creation is initiated through developer tools.
 • B. User is taken to App Exchange: The AppExchange is for finding and installing pre-built apps, not for creating new apps.
 • D. None of the above: This option is incorrect since the user is taken to developer.force.com.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. True.

Here’s why:

When you create a custom tab for an object in Salesforce, you can designate that tab as the "Landing Tab". The landing tab is the first tab that users see when they navigate to the object. This is particularly useful when you want to provide users with a focused experience by having a specific tab appear first when they access a certain section of Salesforce.

You can specify which tab should be the landing tab for a given object during the process of creating or modifying the tab in Salesforce.

Selected Answer: B
B. False

Explanation:

In Salesforce, you cannot directly set a tab as a “Landing Tab” while creating it for an object. The landing tab is determined by the Default Tab setting in the app configuration or the user’s last active tab (depending on their session). To make a specific tab the landing tab for an app:
 1. Navigate to the App Manager.
 2. Edit the app settings and set the desired tab as the Default Tab for that app.

While creating the tab itself, there is no option to designate it as a landing tab.

Selected Answer: B
